summary: Thomas Dooley, M.D., was charged with failing to meet appropriate standards for quality medical care, specifically regarding his opioid prescribing practices and overall approach to pain medicine for ten patients. Allegations included inadequate monitoring, early prescription refills, and failure to transition patients to long-acting opioids. His medical license was suspended for a minimum of one year, to be followed by a minimum of three years of probation with conditions set by the Board.
